title: Cardano Data Indexing
description: There is no data indexing on Cardano.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a loose statement of a problem. Unfortunately it is not a detailed proposal on how to solve it.
f6_assessments.q1: No detail has been provided on how this would be delivered. See https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Cardano-Analytics-Data-Hub/368258-48088 for a good example of a plan to solve this.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no deliverables or timelines against which to audit delivery of this plan.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement indicated is generic and it is not really clear what impact could have on the Cardano Developers Ecosystem. I suppose that the utility for Devs in having such an index could be in the availabily of data about all Cardano projects, tutorials, NFTs, but it would be great to extend this part of the proposal in order to better expain the real advantages for Cardano Developers.
f6_assessments.q1:
The description of the team involved is completely missing, as well as the previous experience of the proposer.
It would be really usefuil to add technical and operation details about the technologies that will be used (1. to get/track the data that will be indexed 2. The languages/frameworks/infrastructures that will be used to develop and maintain the public API).
The budget breakdown should be more deatailed and cover the various parts of the development, fir example it would be great to combine it with a developmente roadmap and indicate the estimated hours for each milestone of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is only partially clear what the final product will be: the tokenless protocol, the public APIs, the analysis made on the on-chain data? It would be really good to better explain these aspects in order to provide to the community a way to track the development of the project if funded.
The definition of some Key Performance Indicators to track the success of the project (e.g. no. of projects/nfts indexed, no. of API requests etc.) coul add great value to the proposal and will impove its auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano DB-synch offers the indexing service for the data in the Cardano Blockchain. Therefore it is not clear why the proposal is for creating an indexing service. The data in the chain is increasing at a good rate, and keeping up an elastic search with big data models is the ideal case. Therefore the exact aim of the proposal is not clear.
f6_assessments.q1: There is very limited information about the proposer in the proposal which could be used for evaluating the experience.
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables of the project is not listed and have been expressed in subjective terms. 20K USD for slush fund has been included in the proposal, which is extraordinary for open community-funded projects. The proposal is not clear in terms of audibility.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is only a description of an idea without explaining how it should be implemented. There is no reference to the Challenge, how the Developer Ecosystem can be further developed. The given information does not explain the impact on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no link to the proposer, no references or a proof-of-live. As I said, only an idea is mentioned, but without presenting a practical implementation strategy. The budget is only roughly mentioned. Overall, too much information is missing to expect an implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer presents a roadmap without any explanation of how it can be implemented. No documentation sources are mentioned that the community could use to follow the implementation. Overall, an immature proposal, in which the points mentioned should be added to get a better rating.

solution: Creating an indexing protocol, sift and sort all on-chain data and then offer organized data sets to developers and institutions.
